intro: Barleria amanensis, commonly known as the common barleria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a perennial herb or shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, or purple, which bloom from spring to autumn. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. Barleria amanensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant floral display.
